1.label: On/Off Status Recovery After Power Failure

options.label: Remember Previous State After Power Failure
Power Strip Automatically ON After Power Failure
Power Strip Automatically OFF After Power Failure

2.label: Power Wattage Report Value Threshold
2.description: Choose how you want your Power Strip to report power consumption to your hub

3.label: Power Wattage Report Frequency
3.description: The number entered as value corresponds to the number of seconds

4.label: Energy (kWh) Report Frequency
4.description: Report interval of power consumption (W) to your controller (hub)

5.label: Overload Protection
5.description: Set the Watt level for overload protection to kick in

6.label: CH1 Auto Turn-Off Timer
6.description: Enable or disable the auto turn-off timer for CH1 outlet

7.label: CH1 Auto Turn-Off Setting
7.description: Time in minutes to turn off the device connected to CH1 after being turned on

8.label: CH1 Auto Turn-On Timer
8.description: Enable or disable the auto turn-on timer for CH1 outlet

9.label: CH1 Auto Turn-On Setting
9.description: Time in minutes to turn on the device connected to CH1 after being turned off.

13.label: CH2 Auto Turn-On Setting
13.description: Time in minutes to turn on the device connected to CH2 after being turned off

Manual control enabled for all outlets
LED on when power is off and off when power is on
